title: I don't want to join any coaching centre for the UPSC preparation. What should be my strategy from the beginning of my preparation? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: First complete ncert books class 6th to 12th ( for specific subjects like geography.. etc). This will help to make your basics strong. “Strong foundation, strong building”… Second Analyse previous year question papers ( to observe the trend and weightage given to each subject ) Read publications books ( spectrum, Tata MC grawhill books ). Read one book i.e, standard reference for each subject ( Avoid purchasing multiple books for single subject). Make notes out of it or you can highlight important points with Highlighter…. Last but not the least , attempt as many mock ttests as you can. Never underestimate the power of test series. These are score boosters. Many are available in the market, choose one out of them and assess your preparation. First you can get less marks but you will observe improvement after few days….. As usual read the Hindu daily…. Spend quality time on your preparation. Time management is important. Content is important not hours of study… Attempt as many mocks as you can… analyse your weak sections and try to make them strong … All the best

See friend there is no need to join coaching now a days because everything is available on internet .. First of all you have to read NCERTs from class 6–12 ,this will clear your basic concept after that you can go for the standard books Practice daily after preparation for mains by writing answers . Follow the hindu if you are from English medium background . You can watch videos on unacademy which is India's largest educational platform . Do self-study more and more . After doing all these things you do not need any coaching to crack UPSC .
